alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued November 21 at 2:01AM AKST until November 21 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as one quarter mile. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds have peaked and started to diminish. However, the arrival of light falling snow is combining with blowing snow on the ground to continue to produce blizzard conditions. Precipitation will end overnight and winds will continue to diminish, gradually leading to improved visibilities.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
